DOC.brief_title: New Prophylactic Maneuver : `` Pushing '' Maneuver , Aiming Reduce Risk Shoulder Dystocia
DOC.detailed_description: Hypothesis : `` push '' maneuver reduce 50 % risk shoulder dystocia comparison either expectative attitude suction fetal nose mouth . Main objective : ass whether prophylactic use `` push fetal head '' maneuver decrease prevalence shoulder dystocia , comparison expectative attitude suction fetal nose mouth . Secondary objective : compare occurrence neonatal complication include brachial plexus injury , clavicle humerus fracture , hematoma generalize asphyxia . Main criterion : occurrence shoulder dystocia , define necessity require specific obstetrical maneuver ( McRoberts ' maneuver ) . Secondary criterion : neonatal complication include neurological damage ( brachial plexus injury ) , generalize asphyxia , hematoma , clavicle humerus fracture . Methods : prospective , randomize , multicenter blind study modify intention-to-treat analysis . Patients include last obstetrical consultation randomize delivery room . Number patient ( α error , β error ) : sample size 1126 patient calculate allow detection 50 % reduction shoulder dystocia , prevalence dystocia reach 4.3 % usual delivery ( expectative attitude suction fetal nose mouth ) , 65 % dystocia risk decrease group C ( α error 0.05 , β error 0.20 ) . Inclusion exclusion criterion . Inclusion : woman complete 37 gestational week singleton vertex fetus , deliver vaginally . Exclusion : patient caesarean section exclude . Place study : department gynecology obstetrics , BEAUJON hospital , Clichy , France department gynecology obstetrics , BICHAT hospital , Paris , France . Duration inclusion : two year 6 month Duration patient ' participation : two month maximum Duration study : two year 9 month .
